description: Major breakpoints used globally in Bolt.

context.name: bolt-breakpoints
context.value:
(
  xxsmall:  320px,
  xsmall:   400px,
  small:    600px,
  medium:   800px,
  large:    1000px,
  xlarge:   1200px,
  xxlarge:  1400px,
  xxxlarge: 1920px
)

description: A duplicate of $bolt-breakpoints - used within mq()

see.description:
This provides a wrapper mixin for performing bolt media queries with mq() which allows for the use of:
$from (inclusive min-width boundary), $until (exclusive max-width boundary), $and (additional custom directives), $media-type (media type: screen, print, etc)

context.name: bolt-mq

author: Salem Ghoweri

description: Bolt default color var.
Bolt Brand Colors - merged into $bolt-colors map
Bolt Status Colors - merged into $bolt-colors map
Bolt Social Colors - merged into $bolt-colors map
All Bolt Colors - used within bolt-color @mixin and @function

see.description: Helper functions for applying global color swatches stored in Sass Maps

description:
Bolt's opacity scale.
The keys in this array are the opacity value names and not necessarily numeric.  For example, a valid key could be
"semi-transparent". However, the values in this array must be valid numeric values for the CSS 'opacity' property.

context.name: bolt-font-family--japanese
context.value: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, ' ProN', 'Hiragino Kaku Gothic ProN', '', '', YuGothic, 'Yu Gothic', '', Meiryo, ' ', 'MS Gothic', HiraKakuProN-W3, 'TakaoEx', TakaoExGothic, 'MotoyaLCedar', 'Droid Sans Japanese', sans-serif

description: Default sans-serif fallback font stack containing [1] maps to the system UI font and [2] known system UI fonts. Used within the $bolt-font-families map.

context.name: bolt-font-family--sans-fallback
context.value:
-apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, /* [1] */
  'Segoe UI', 'Roboto', 'Oxygen', 'Ubuntu', 'Cantarell', 'Fira Sans', 'Droid Sans', /* [2] */
  'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif

see.description: Bolt's definition of body, heading, and code text.

context.name: bolt-font-families
context.value:
(
  font-families: (
    body: (
      fallback-font: $bolt-font-family--sans-fallback,
      custom-font:   $bolt-font-family--sans,
      loaded-class:  $bolt-fonts--loaded-class
    ),
    bodySubset: (
      fallback-font: $bolt-font-family--sans-fallback,
      custom-font:   $bolt-font-family--sans-subset,
      loaded-class:  $bolt-fonts--subset-loaded-class
    ),
    heading: (
      fallback-font: $bolt-font-family--sans-fallback,
      custom-font:   $bolt-font-family--sans,
      loaded-class:  $bolt-fonts--loaded-class
    ),
    code: (
      fallback-font: $bolt-font-family--mono-fallback,
      custom-font:   $bolt-font-family--mono,
      loaded-class:  $bolt-fonts--loaded-class
    )
  )
)

author: Mike Mai

description: This applies default font kerning styles for supporting browsers.

font-feature-settings: 'kern';
  font-kerning: normal; // Safari 7+, Firefox 24+, Chrome 33(?)

author: Mike Mai

description: This returns the font-size and relevant line-height for a specific element.

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: Defines the size of the text: xsmall, small, base, medium, large, xlarge, or xxlarge.

parameter.name: leading
parameter.description: Defines the line-height of the text: regular or tight.

author: Mike Mai

$font-weight: map-get-deep($bolt-font-weights, 'font-weights', $weight);

parameter.name: weight

author: Salem Ghoweri

description:
Just checking "@supports (display: contents)" isn't enough to know that a browser supports it FULLY.  So, we check
support for both "display: contents" and "caret-color" (which has similar browser support) -- if a browser fails
either check, it gets the cross-browser fallback instead.

context.name: bolt-if-browser-supports-display-contents

description: Proof quote a value

context.name: _proof-quote
context.code:
// $value: to-string($value);
  @return '"#{$value}"';

usedBy.description: Encode a color to JSON

context.code: @return _proof-quote($color);

usedBy.description: Encode a map to JSON

context.name: _json-encode--map

usedBy.description: Encode a number to JSON

context.name: _json-encode--number
context.code: @return if(unitless($number), $number, _proof-quote($number));

usedBy.description: Encode a string to JSON

context.name: _json-encode--string
context.code: @return _proof-quote($string);
